attributes.action: Keep The Fracking Ban
attributes.background: We would like the government to maintain the ban on fracking. We believe fracking is unsafe for the local communities that live near fracking wells, it will be bad for the environment, it’s not a short-term solution to the energy crisis, and it is opposed by much of rural England.
attributes.additional_details: The government admit that it would take years for shale gas to become an important enough part of our energy mix so fracking won't solve the current energy crisis. Also, we believe extracting shale gas would be a retrograde step when we need to move away from fossil fuels and towards renewable energy. The government should never impose fracking on communities against their will.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require health warnings at point of purchase of fossil fuel energy eg. petrol
attributes.background: Air pollution damages our lungs, hearts and brains; causing 40,000 premature deaths and £20 billion in costs every year in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Burning fossil fuels is a major cause of both air pollution and climate change. It is a public right to understand the dangers of fossil fuels, just as it is for tobacco.

Emerging evidence suggests air pollution worsens covid19 outcomes. Health warnings connect the abstract threat of climate change with the vast array of health risks linked to fossil fuels. They should encourage use of alternatives to fossil fuels, and increase demand for zero-carbon renewable energy. Making fossil fuel use more of a public concern should inspire improvements to cycling and public transport networks, car sharing, EV charging stations and city planning.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Work with the French Government, to protect/save international rail travel.
attributes.background:
Explore options, and/or work with the French Government, to protect/save international rail travel.

We're asking you to consider exploring support options along with the French government to protect international rail travel, in a similar way to that given to the UK's rail and Airline companies.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the Covid-19 pandemic Eurostar International are in a dire financial situation, which could risk the future of international rail travel. Services are been cut to the minimum of one per day, staff have been made redundant, stations have been closed etc. The possibility of the end of high speed international travel now seems very real.

Eurostar, for example, offer a unique alternative to international travel, which creates thousands of jobs and is better for the environment. HS1 is due to become the first UK railway to be powered by renewable energy, there is a great future for Eurostar, for all of us, if Eurostar International and international rail travel in general can survive this. Thank you.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Prepare & deliver a strategy for developing and using Tidal energy in the UK
attributes.background: To develop a comprehensive strategy to use Tidal energy across the UK. Offer grants to support tidal arrays or tidal farms to help businesses develop a reliable 24/7 renewable energy.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce carbon emissions energy needs to be produced without using fossil fuels - tidal energy can help do this.
 
The UK has developed a renewable industry based predominantly on bioenergy, solar & wind power. The UK still relies on energy from fossil fuels in addition up to importing energy via interconnectors. The UK has an underused resource around the country. Tide should be used to a greater extent than it is. Grants should be given to help business develop this resource. The UK could develop technologies supporting jobs & allow an export market to be developed for British businesses.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Include vehicle battery and charger manufacture in vehicle emissions reporting
attributes.background: Government must include battery and charger manufacture in emissions measurement and change the way manufacturers are required to report CO2 emissions to the Government. 'Tailpipe only' is an unfair measurement. We must also account for environmentally harmful practices such as Lithium extraction.
attributes.additional_details:
Clean fuels use normal petrol or diesel pumps, no need for environmentally damaging charger installs everywhere.
Battery manufacture creates high co2 emissions, adds cost & Lithium is not renewable!
To be practical for widespread EV car and van use we will need a huge amount of chargers to be made which will increase emissions not reduce them!
Cobalt mining is still associated with Child Labour.
Biomethane can be CO2 negative full lifecycle.
Synthetic efuel or electrofuels can be made with clean energy.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables
attributes.background:
It's a no-brainer. This is a crisis the Government must address by the cheapest, quickest, most environmentally friendly, safest, and most job-creative means. 

Promote and increase Government investment in renewables.
attributes.additional_details:
Fossil fuels are ruining the climate and environment. Nuclear is unsafe.

Home-grown renewable energy and insulating our buildings so we don't lose the heat we produce will create more jobs, be cheaper and be quicker in reducing energy prices and global warming.
We ask the Government to think of the good of our country, our global environment and its people.
 
Increase Government investment in:
- Underwater turbines to harness tidal flows and estuary currents
- Wind farms
- Solar panels.
- Battery technology to store energy.
- Insulation of buildings.

Action, not words, are needed.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Introduce grants for home battery storage systems
attributes.background: Roll out a grant for home battery storage systems to help reduce the reliance on foreign energy supplies such as gas from Russia, by enabling households to store electricity generated renewably, including domestic solar generation.
attributes.additional_details:
This could also reduce C02 output helping towards Government C02 targets.

Our reliance on foreign fuels such as gas and oil, has been driving up household energy costs and this will become more of an issue with the current war in Ukraine, and deteriorating relations with Russia.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Join the Beyond Oil and Gas Alliance and commit to its end date for fossil fuels
attributes.background: We are asking the government to join the Beyond Oil and Gas Alliance (spearheaded by Denmark and Costa Rica), commit to its end date by starting the decommissioning processes for extant fossil fuel extraction projects and power stations, and preventing licences for new projects.
attributes.additional_details: The climate crisis is a huge threat to life as we know it. To combat this, the government must transition to renewable energy as fast as possible. Now is the time for rapid, decisive action, not empty rhetoric. The Government must have more ambition in safeguarding the future of its people.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Provide interest-free Renewable Energy Assistance Loan during energy crisis.
attributes.background:
A win-win plan that gives immediate and long-term benefits: 
Government to provide interest-free loans to homes for installing renewable energy equipment (solar panel, heat pump, retrofit).
This will reduce monthly utility bills for homes. The savings can repay the loan over 5-7 years.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple plan that benefits everyone:

Households – Immediate cash savings vs paying hefty bills to energy suppliers; less dependency on the grid; no-interest cost on buying expensive equipment. 

Government –  Reduction in inflation; the UK can become energy secure in a few years, also meeting its climate targets 

Suppliers – They can buy excess energy from households at a low cost; they can work with the government in installation, maintenance, billing, and awareness-building.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Decarbonise UK energy by funding locally-owned renewable micro-grids
attributes.background:
It will cost tens of billions to make electricity production carbon-neutral, but the current national grid is inefficient, with 8-10% of energy lost in distribution or transmission.
 
The Government should instead fund resident-owned renewable energy grids across the country. Power to the people.
attributes.additional_details: We believe the current electricity grid will be both supplemented and superseded by micro-grids, which can provide most of the benefits with fewer downsides - reducing waste, cost and carbon footprint. Micro-grids work locally within the grid system, but can operate independently of the grid if the need or want arises, to power homes, factories, cars or hospitals.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet
attributes.background: Following the airing of David Attenborough’s programme “Life on our planet”, the Government should take action and implement new laws, restrictions and taxes to: reduce meat production and consumption, switch to 100% renewable energy, stop all deforestation and ban over-fishing.
attributes.additional_details: We are at a critical tipping point. If we do not make changes now, it will be too late. In a matter of less than 10 years, we could see irreversible change that will have devastating impacts for the planet, and our species. We need to start acting on what the experts & natural world is telling and showing us in order to save the planet. We are an influential nation - if we create lasting change, others will follow and we will make the difference desperately needed.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Increase requirements and support for renewable energy for domestic property
attributes.background: Legislate that all new buildings should have at least one renewable energy source & increase support to encourage & assist renewable energy to be taken up by existing home owners.
attributes.additional_details: Harnessing the sun and the wind is sustainable energy. It is more difficult to convert and adapt buildings already built and with massive building programs already taking place, very few have solar panels, ground source heat pumps or any other renewable energy. The Government should take steps to address this before it’s too late.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Introduce a carbon tax
attributes.background: The government should introduce a tax on all commodities and activities that emit carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. For example, there should be a tax on flying by plane etc.
attributes.additional_details: The government should do this to help the fight against climate change. As the price of carbon-emitting activities increase, the consumption of such products should decrease, which should cause more people to shift to renewable energy. This could greatly reduce the carbon footprint of the UK.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Require new large buildings include renewable energy generation
attributes.background: We want the Government to require new buildings to include renewable power generation, such as solar energy, to ensure that all future commercial and residential building developments accommodating 50 or more people can meet at least 25% of their energy needs for integrated renewable generation.
attributes.additional_details: We want the Government to help us make a cleaner future for all in the UK. Starting by tackling one of the biggest users of fossil fuels; larger residential buildings and workplaces. We want this because in 2020, the UK's fossil fuel dependency was 76.5%. This high consumption of damaging resources puts our future in jeopardy. Introducing a legally bound 25% minimum dependence on integrated renewable energy should reduce reliance on fossil fuels and decrease current over consumption.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030
attributes.background: We would like the Government to seek to reduce carbon emissions by considerable amounts by setting a target to increase the UK's renewable energy generation to account for 70% of all energy. By achieving this we hope to reduce pollution and the amount of carbon emissions from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: We would like to stop climate change progressing further than it's currently estimated to rise to in order to save our planet. Fossil fuels are one of the biggest contributors to climate change. Not only that but we rely on fossil fuels to complete everyday tasks. However, fossil fuels will eventually run out so we need a suitable solution to fall back on. To save ourselves and our planet we must make more use of renewable energy sources such as hydro-electric, solar and wind energy.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Add a 'sustainability charge' on meat products to cover their environmental cost
attributes.background: Food production accounts for one-quarter of the world’s greenhouse gas emissions and takes up half of the planet’s habitable surface. The mass of animals raised for slaughter on Earth now outweighs wildlife by a factor of 15-to-1. One kilogram of beef needs about 15 thousand litres of water.
attributes.additional_details: By adding a 'sustainability charge' to meat products, this will encourage more conscious meat consumption. With this money going towards tackling climate change and renewable energy resources.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Impose new taxes on private jets to increase investment in renewables
attributes.background: The aviation industry emits 12% of all transport carbon dioxide emissions. We want the Government to impose new taxes on the use of private jets, to try and reduce CO2 emissions and raise funds to invest in renewable energy, green transportation, and electric vehicle infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details: I believe I can speak on behalf of the planet when I say, we have had enough. We desperately need to reduce the level of carbon emissions entering our atmosphere before we are responsible for the mass extinction of almost 90% of marine species, and the millions of individuals at risk from rising sea levels.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Change the Energy Profits Levy (EPL) to help UK households and the climate.
attributes.background: The new investment allowance of 91p (for every £1 spent by the oil and gas sector e.g. companies such as BP and Shell) should apply solely to investment in renewable energy projects. The investment allowance for investing in oil and gas extraction should be reduced to 25p for every £1 spent.
attributes.additional_details: The energy sector can make 91p tax saving for every £1 spent on oil and gas extraction in the UK. This was originally 46p. The new tax saving doesn't apply to renewable energy projects. The UK Government expects £5 billion in tax revenue from the EPL. The 5 biggest oil companies shared profits of nearly $100bn in 1st 6 months of 2022. People need help this winter to afford fuel and food. The economy will need further support. £5 billion additional tax revenue from the current EPL isn't enough.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Fund free solar panels for all homes
attributes.background: The Government should fund the installation of solar panels for all existing homes and require solar panels to be installed on all new-build homes within 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
This would significantly contribute to phasing out the use of fossil fuels and allow the UK to take a global lead in fighting climate change.
 
Combating climate change takes steps, and converting our energy uses and harnessing the best natural renewable energy is one of them.
We are already on our way to switching to electric vehicles, we are opening our eyes to the effect we have on the planet.
Let’s live in a clean, renewable country and take a global lead in combating climate change immediately.
We need to act decisively if we want to preserve our way of life, and to protect the animals that are innocent in all of this.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban drilling for fossil fuels and put more money into using renewable energy.
attributes.background: We see destruction to the environment every day that passes. I believe by banning the drilling on fossil fuels, we can make a difference to what is happening to the Earth right now, alternatively we should use renewable energy and have the government use the technology we have right now.
attributes.additional_details: The banning of drilling for fossil fuels will push more to our goals for the climate, In a few months COP26 will be held in Scotland to discuss the climate crisis; by then it may be more frequent in use meaning more research to improve renewable energy. Thirdly, I believe by doing this other world leaders will follow by example by doing the right thing for the Earth, climate change affects everyone and we need to actually do something longer term rather than short term.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Reintroduce Feed-in Tariffs for domestic solar panels
attributes.background: Help private households reduce their bills and promote the uptake of renewable energy by reopening the Feed-in Tariffs scheme to new applicants, so households can sell surplus energy back to the grid through a Government scheme.
attributes.additional_details: There are millions of roofs across the country that could be reducing England's carbon footprint and making us less vulnerable to bill increases from energy providers. The Government can help achieve this by reinstating financial incentives for installing renewable technology.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: All infrastructure projects be tested against the Net Zero Emissions 2050 Law
attributes.background: Ensure that all current and future infrastructure projects as part of Budget 2020 and beyond are rigorously tested against the Net Zero Emissions 2050 law. Sustainable and low carbon projects should then be prioritised including renewable energy and mass public transit.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence that we are in the midst of a global climate emergency is obvious, the science is obvious. But more than that we can see the impact of climate change every day from floods, to bush fires, Greenland and Antarctica ice melting faster than ever, to the decline in biodiversity. This is not a drill, we need real leadership and we need it now. 

This government speaks about the people's priorities and surely the biggest priority for everyone is a planet that is safe to live on.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Only fund renewable energy projects manufactured in the UK
attributes.background: The Government should only fund UK renewable energy projects that are manufactured in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The UK heavy engineering and fabrication industry is currently on its knees, we are seeing renewable energy projects/contracts led by overseas companies/consortiums receive public funding while UK yards lie empty and UK jobs suffer. This has to stop. How can an industry be revitalised when the UK Government is providing funding to projects led by overseas companies and consortiums?

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: UK Government: restrict reduced VAT on domestic energy to renewable sources only
attributes.background: Apply the reduced VAT rate on energy consumption - currently 5% - only where supplies of that energy derive from a renewable source.
attributes.additional_details: To demonstrate that the UK is serious about reaching net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Ban the importation of wood pellets used for the generation of electricity.
attributes.background: Importation of wood pellets should be banned and the use in power stations should be urgently reviewed. Burning of wood pellets must not be considered sustainable or a means of meeting net zero targets. Billions of UK green subsidies into this technology must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Using wood pellets releases more CO2 than burning coal. Because the government considers wood pellets as a renewable resource, by re-planting trees, the emissions are classed as carbon neutral and “helps” to get closer to the neutral target in 2030. This is not the case. Deforestation is happening around the world to supply the UK with wood pellets for burning, which generates around 11% of our energy needs. British taxpayers are funding this destruction of forests.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make VAT zero for all Battery Systems used with Renewable Energy generation
attributes.background: Addition of a battery to a renewable energy system allows optimum use of on-site renewable energy, thereby reducing demand on the National Grid.
attributes.additional_details:
We want VAT zero on battery systems used with renewable energy generation, for home or business use, regardless of when this is installed.

Renewable energy promotion is part of UK Government strategy.

Many homes and small businesses have on-site renewable electricity generation, such as Solar Photovoltaic or Wind turbine.

At the time of writing, if a property owner orders a renewable energy system with simultaneous installation of a battery, this is NOT liable to VAT. Retrospective addition of a battery is currently liable to VAT.
For many system owners, the battery option may not have been available at time of install. The current difference in tax liability is unjust.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Invest in new nuclear and renewable generation to replace fossil fuels
attributes.background: This petition calls for investment in a hybrid system of renewable energy (solar panels and wind turbines) with nuclear power plants, to be built on a national scale. This will combine the advantages of both to help make a real difference to the climate crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
40°C is not a normal temperature for the UK, yet it happened this July. If we don't act now, climate change will only get worse.

An effective way to tackle this it is to transform the way we produce electricity. Scientific advancements have made it possible to phase out non-renewables: renewable energy is cheaper (than non-renewables) and easy to build on a large scale but are less reliable. As nuclear plants are both safe and reliable, a hybrid system of both should help cut down greenhouse emissions.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Enable the Government to access Bank of England GRANTS to fund Public Services!
attributes.background:
The current methods of funding Public Services through taxation, borrowing & profits from the Public Sector limit the UK Government’s ability to improve Public Services and Living Standards

If the UK Government didn't have limited finance available to it, it could be capable of greater investment
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government should be able to fund spending on Public Services from the Bank of England to Improve Living Standards.

The Government could use this funding to increase Minimum Wage, Pensions, Improve Public Services like the NHS and protect our Planet better.

Government can also help finance Scientific & Medical Research much better. Financial Incentives and Support can be given by Government to Industries to go Carbon Neutral & Energy Providers to produce Clean & Renewable Energy.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Set a target for 100% renewable energy by 2022
attributes.background: The Government needs to set a target for 100% renewable energy target by 2022. The Government had decades to support a move to renewable energy and they can do this if they got up and worked to tackle the current climate crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to act extremely quick and hard against this climate crisis. This is the biggest crisis we have ever faced. It’s sad to see politicians doing the bare minimum to fight against the crisis; they don’t care enough and turn a blind eye to this crisis.
 
We all have been seeing these effects for decades now. It can only get worse from now if we don’t take action NOW. NOW is when the action needs to start, not tomorrow, not next week, not next month, not next year, NOW.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Stop the coalmine in Cumbria.
attributes.background:
Michael Gove has approved plans for the UK will build its first new coalmine for three decades in Cumbria, despite objections locally, across the UK and from around the world.
It will cause an estimated 400,000 tonnes of greenhouse gas emissions a year.
attributes.additional_details:
This puts the fossil fuel industry before people and the planet and cancels out any progress Britain has made on renewable energy.

This is investing in the damaging sources of energy from the last century and not the clean energy needed for children's future.

A new coalmine would have no impact on reducing energy bills or ensuring our energy security.

There is an urgent need to reduce the consumption of fossil fuels and this is  undermining the most important global issue of our times

attributes.action: Remove the merit order for Energy pricing. 100% Renewables = Renewables pricing
attributes.background:
Removing the Merit order of power will ensure energy users that have invested in renewable power over years of paying more for said renewables will get the benefits of those renewables entering the grid.
People that didn't have the forsight to opt in for renewables will pay for their past choices.
attributes.additional_details:
As discussed by Good Energy on the blog linked below, the current Wholesale Energy Price is determined by the Merit Order of energy.
That means that regardless of selecting 100% renewable energy or not, you are paying for the expensive gas kWs of power entering the grid.
Removing the merit order will ensure those that have invested in Renewables being added to the grid will get that benefit now.
https://www.goodenergy.co.uk/why-does-the-price-of-gas-drive-electricity-prices-including-renewables/

rejection.details:
Petitions must ask for a clear action from the Government or Parliament. We can see that you'd like to reform how energy prices are set to create more of a link between the price you pay for energy and whether you've "opted in" to renewables. 

Unfortunately, it isn't clear how removing the merit order for pricing would achieve this. While there are renewable energy tariffs, most energy tariffs do not specify the technologies that will be used, and indeed use a mix of different technologies. It's unclear how removing the merit order would guarantee that the tariff would be based on a renewable technology source.

You might be able to start a petition calling for the Government to reform how it sets the prices which energy generators receive from customers. The Government is currently consulting on this area - you might like to feed into its consultation. Its consultation closes on 10 October: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/review-of-electricity-market-arrangements

attributes.action: Introduce right to 'Net Metering' for generation of renewable energy
attributes.background: Net Metering would credit the amount of energy exported during times of surplus against import at times when generation is low or not available.
attributes.additional_details:
Any account holder with grid-connected on-site renewable generation should have access to this type of contract.

The Feed in Tariff for renewable energy generation on homes and businesses closed to new entrants. Since then, payment for generation & export has not kept pace with rapidly rising cost of energy purchase.

Smart meters measure electricity import from, and export to the grid. This makes it technically possible to implement a Net Metering contract.

Example: Solar system credit would be accrued during clear sunny days and paid back later.

An account holder with surplus energy credit could donate to others, to people in need.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: A minimum price paid for the export of electricity from domestic renewables
attributes.background: We have a pricing cap on the cost of gas/electricity, why do we not have a minimum price set by the government for electricity generated by solar panels or other home renewables. It’s not fair we are getting paid a paltry 2p or 3.5p per kWh when the energy companies will be selling it for 20p to 30p
attributes.additional_details: To get a fairer return on people choosing to install home renewables and battery systems. We don’t want the feed in tariff prices back but a fair price that is reviewed like the energy cap. Take for instance the price for nuclear is around 9p per kWh at Hinckley. A fairer price would encourage people to invest in home renewables and reduce the overall carbon footprint of households.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The rate paid to people using the Smart Export Guarantee (SEG) are set by electricity suppliers (SEG Licencees), not the Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Pause the determination of all solar developments that are over 40 Megawatts.
attributes.background: Government should review the regulatory framework which is in place to manage solar developments, to ensure it considers a broader range of factors than the current National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), which is insufficient in preventing speculative development of our landscape.
attributes.additional_details: No solar development should be approved until their impact on the environment and biodiversity is understood. There is currently a clear policy conflict within Government.  On the one hand, Government seeks to protect and enhance our domestic production to maintain food security and recognises the pivotal role of farm land as a carbon sink. On the other, Government is encouraging the indiscriminate growth of renewable energy production. Growth of solar farms must be subject to better regulation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you are concerned about the impact that solar farms might have on the environment and would like to see changes to the regulations, but it's not clear if you want all approval of solar farms stopped or if you want changes to the regulations, and if so, what regulations on solar farms would you like the Government to action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Sustainable Reform - 8 proposals for fundamental changes to British politics
attributes.background:
1 Mental health reform. 
 2 Electoral reform. (proportional)
 3 Industrial reform (hemp).
 4  Secular spiritual reform (Wellness studies and Education in the nature of the mind)
 5 Energy reform (renewable energy.)
6 Universal Basic Income
7 Gross National Happiness.
8 Police reform
attributes.additional_details:
1 Mental health reform, a preventative approach 
 2 Electoral reform (proportional)
 3 Industrial Reform - Hemp can replace almost every aspect of the oil industry. 
 4 Secular Spiritual Reform (Wellness studies and Education in the nature of the mind)
 5 Energy reform (renewable energy.)
Every human on the planet needs clean air and clean water.
6 Universal Basic Income
7 Gross National Happiness
The collective happiness and well-being
8 Police admissions reform - More psychological testing

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do in each of these chases
	
You could start new petitions explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Stop all new gas, oil and coal extraction
attributes.background: Stop all new gas, oil and coal extraction by banning any new mines, gas or oil fields being explored or started.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change needs drastic, fast action NOW to stop humankind killing our planet.
NO fossil fuels should be extracted from the earth any more.
Money should instead be put into renewable energy, wind, water and solar. Immediately and in large quantity to try to halt the damage we are doing to our only home and that of our children and their futures.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Enable the Government to access Bank of England GRANTS to fund Public Services!
attributes.background: The current methods of funding Public Services through taxation, borrowing & profits from the Public Sector limit the UK Government’s ability to improve Public Services and Living Standards. If the UK Government didn't have limited finance available to it, it could be capable of greater investment.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government should be able to fund spending on Public Services from the Bank of England to Improve Living Standards.

The Government could use this funding to increase Minimum Wage, Pensions, Improve Public Services like the NHS and protect our Planet better.

Government can also help finance Scientific & Medical Research much better. Financial Incentives and Support can be given by Government to Industries to go Carbon Neutral & Energy Providers to produce Clean & Renewable Energy.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: The government to take control of the British energy companies ensuring morality
attributes.background: Using law, sieze control of the British energy companies to ensure standards of fairness are upheld. Principally to make sure fair morally and ethical standards are maintained for the British public.
attributes.additional_details: Energy rises have been thrust upon the British people that do not match inflation in any way. Excuses have been made, but the control of British energy companies by Europe is ensuring we are punished. Because this is morally wrong, we should take control of this ourselves in Britain. Use the renewable energy sources as much as possible ourselves. Pass much of the savings to the public.

attributes.action: Increase UK content for UK Renewable / Energy projects and protect UK Jobs
attributes.background: Engage with developers at initial phase and enforce a majority  percentage of UK content supplied services / products.
attributes.additional_details: By ensuring a large number of skilled highly paid jobs it will only benefit the economy with the jump start it needs after the devastating levels of unemployment resulting after the Covid crisis. Also to deliver on promises / statements made by government after we leave the EU

rejection.details:
We understand you want more involvement for UK companies and materials in energy projects, however it's not clear what you want the Government to do to achieve this. Further, the materials and suppliers any individual business chooses to use would be a matter for them, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to create a green jobs fund for which only UK residents are eligible, if that is something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Change the pricing of Renewable Energy so that it is no longer set by Gas Prices
attributes.background: The Government & Parliament should reconsider the pricing mechanism for Renewable Energy in the UK. Electricity generators usually have contracts which tie their price to the “market”, which usually is set by gas. This is horribly outdated and we need to see it changed to encourage green energy.
attributes.additional_details: We are a family of three living in South Devon. We don't want our young daughter's life to be horribly affected by climate change. We signed up to a 100% renewable electricity scheme in 2020 through Octopus Energy. We were happy to pay a premium for this renewable supply of energy over the fossil fuel rate because we believe in leading through positive action. We strongly believe that renewable energy consumers should not be punished by increasing gas prices, as has been the case for our family.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the increased cost of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The energy price cap is backstop protection from the government for people who default onto their supplier's basic energy tariff. Ofgem calculates the cap level that suppliers must apply to these tariffs. The cap does not apply to customers that have chosen a standard variable green energy tariff Ofgem has exempted from the cap. For customers on a standard variable green energy tariff it is up to individual energy providers what to charge.

You can find out more about the energy price cap here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: create a separate price cap for renewable energy, specifically Heat Pumps!
attributes.background: Get the Government to create a separate price cap for renewable energy specifically Air Source and Ground Source Heat Pumps! This will create a lower Price for KW hours and encourage more people to adopt this technology
attributes.additional_details:
This action by the government will ensure that consumers pay less by adopting ground source (geothermal) and air source heat pump which will encourage more people to adopt these technologie!
This will significantly help the government meet its 600,000 heat pumps per year!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to encourage the uptake of renewable energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. If a household installs a heat pump then they will pay for the energy needed to power the pump, but won't have to pay anything for the heat generated by the pump.

There is a Domestic Renewable Heat Incentive (RHI), which can be claimed for certain heat pumps: https://www.gov.uk/domestic-renewable-heat-incentive

If you want the Government to expand incentives to install heat pumps, we could accept a petition requesting this, but it would need to be clear what incentives you wanted the Government to offer.

attributes.action: Provide global climate leadership by ending any new UK oil and gas extraction
attributes.background: Greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel burning are choking our planet and putting billions of people at immediate risk. But the UK Government plans to allow new oil and gas fields to start up between now and 2050. The UK Government must change policy and stop any new UK oil and gas extraction.
attributes.additional_details:
The viability of our societies depends on limiting global temperature rise to 1.5°C above the pre-industrial era average. It has already risen 1.1°C. 

Without deep carbon and methane pollution cuts (from burning fossil fuels) between now and 2030, the 1.5°C goal is unachievable. 

The UK Government must show global climate leadership by ending any new oil and gas extraction and announce support for a rapid expansion of renewable energy and a plan for increasing energy efficiency of UK homes.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594797

attributes.action: Set minimum export price for electricity under the Smart Export Guarantee
attributes.background: Set minimum export price for energy companies purchasing electricity under the SEG tariff to be at least 25% of the import price for customers
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the current energy crisis the price per kw for electricity was approx. 18p plus a standing charge of 20p per day. Now it's 27p per kw plus 50p standing charge and this is due to increase again by October. Yet the export price under the Smart Export Guarantee has dropped from an average of 6p per kw to 3p. I believe this to be an unfair disparity and request the government step in to regulate to ensure fair prices and to encourage home owners to purchase renewables.

attributes.action: Require LPAs hold referendums on support for onshore renewables by April 2024
attributes.background: Every local planning authority (LPA) should be required to have a referendum on whether their constituents support onshore renewables, so the results can inform local plans/policy immediately, and help give certainty to energy companies wanting to deploy renewable technologies.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite an energy crisis, largely subsidy-free delivery, public opinion polls showing support, debunking of health concerns and noise reduction from innovation, there is still significant resistance to onshore renewables such as wind and many councils block planning applications for onshore renewables.
 
We believe requiring referendums across the country, to gauge support for onshore renewables, should help make sure LPA policy better reflects the will of the people.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Enquiry and Overhaul of the National Grid Energy Tarriff System.
attributes.background: Develop two wholesale markets - one for renewable and one for brown energy and the ability for the consumer to transparently purchase this energy with a certificate of origin clearly established under the green code transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK energy market (designed by civil servants, regulators, politicians and primarily Oil and Gas companies) has a single market price for electricity - from whatever source it is generated, whether that be clean renewable or gas and coal.

Renewable energy costs, wind, solar, geothermal are generally fixed provision of energy cost without too much fluctuation in operating costs as they are not dependant on feed stock such as gas, coal or fuel oil to generate the electricity.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the electricity market, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There is not a single price for electricity, and electricity providers generate and buy electricity in a range of different ways. Your petition calls on the Government to create two wholesale markets, but it's not clear how this could be achieved.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to review and reform the electricity market, with a view to increasing transparency about how the electricity customers use is generated, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Fit all new build houses with renewable energy devices.
attributes.background: To make all new build homes suitable for a more eco freindly future, this would require all new buildings to fit or attach a minimum of 4 solar panels or a renewable energy device with an equivalent power output.
attributes.additional_details: With the environment suffering with emission control, and the all countries focusing on vehicle production becoming  all electric by 2030 it seems vital that every household should be concentrating on producing electricity to help power stations  from burning excessive fossil fuels. This seems like a great opportunity to start building a more environmentally friendly britain and start a trend all coutries should embrace.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573013

attributes.action: Reintroduce grants for PV(Solar) installation on domestic properties.
attributes.background: The only way out of the energy crisis is to move away from dependency on fossil fuels and the only way to do this is to focus, develop and implement renewable energy technologies.The installation of renewable technologies is  too expensive to contemplate. Let's help home owners afford them.
attributes.additional_details:
How will it be paid for?
-there are 1.2million people in this country that earn more than £100,000 a year.  temporarily remove the personal tax allowance on all these people. This raises almost £2.5billion a year in tax. 
- The windfall tax on energy companies can be continued while these profits continue. 

The  PV grants  will...
Enable home owners to afford PV.
Reduce demand on our national grid
Reduce damage to the environment
Increase supply and lower gas prices.
Boost sustainable energy

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Increase subsidies and grants for homeowners to improve their energy ratings: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619507

attributes.action: Hold a general election in the spring of 2023.
attributes.background: The new PM will have had months in post by the end of 2022 so the public will be aware of their policies and direction. All parties would have time to prepare for an election. An election would reinvigorate political parties & force them to come up with policies that help the country collectively.
attributes.additional_details: Brexit hasn't been done and many of the manifesto policies have been scrapped or changed. We are plodding along in a climate emergency, yet the govt have very few policy ideas to alleviate the impact, let alone stick to their climate commitments. There are strikes, crises in almost every department from NHS & social care to the DWP. A general election would force a rethink and hopefully introduce fresh policies and renewed energy for the things people need.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611905

attributes.action: Review recent energy strategy to make planning for onshore wind turbines easier
attributes.background: There is an energy crisis and climate emergency now. Onshore wind turbines are cheap, effective and quick to install. Onshore wind linked with Hydrogen storage would be a good way to provide clean green renewable energy 100% of the time quicker than the governments proposed strategy.
attributes.additional_details: Debate the planning legislation with regard to onshore wind to put it on a par with a war footing due to the urgent nature and vulnerability of the climate emergency and energy crisis. Consider permitted development on existing wind turbine sites to permit a blade tip height of 119m. Similarly, planning legislation with regards to wayleaves, easements for   infrastructure and grid connections  with a view to streamline and simplify planning and connections for onshore wind.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

It's not clear if you want the Government to review its energy security strategy, or planning legislation, or both, or make changes to planning legislation, and if the latter what changes you want to be made.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Scale/speed up renewable energy to reduce carbon/costs and increase security
attributes.background: Increase the roll-out of UK renewables, specifically Solar, Wind, Tidal and Green Hydrogen, in order to reduce our reliance on fossil fuels for electricity generation. Also, increase research into increasing available storage capacity for renewable energy. Increase the FIT to encourage PV panels.
attributes.additional_details: In October 2021, Sky News reported that over half of the UK's electricity was produced from natural gas. We are currently on course for a global temperature rise in the next century with devastating consequences. A proportion of UK gas supply comes from Russia, who at the time of writing are on the brink of invading Ukraine. It is imperative that UK takes control of it's own electricity supply from renewable sources which unlike fossil fuels cannot be laid claim to by a particular nation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see a faster transition to renewable energy, but it's not clear what you want the Government to do to incentivise increased renewable capacity.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Prepare & deliver a strategy for developing and using Tidal energy in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598785

Require new large buildings include renewable energy generation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600894
